quiz.title: Unit 1: Foundations \u0026 Measurement (Quiz 11)
quiz.subtitle: Dimensional Analysis and Mixed Unit Conversions (10 Questions)
quiz.subject: Physics

questions.question: Given that Mass $= M$, Length $= L$, and Time $= T$, what is the dimension of momentum? (Momentum $=$ mass $\times$ velocity)
questions.explanation: Velocity $= LT^{-1}$, so momentum $= M \times LT^{-1} = MLT^{-1}$.

questions.question: Given that Mass $= M$, Length $= L$, and Time $= T$, what is the dimension of impulse? (Impulse $=$ force $\times$ time)
questions.explanation: Force $= MLT^{-2}$, so impulse $= MLT^{-2} \times T = MLT^{-1}$.

questions.question: Given that Mass $= M$, Length $= L$, and Time $= T$, what is the dimension of pressure? (Pressure $=$ force $/$ area)
questions.explanation: Force $= MLT^{-2}$, area $= L^2$, so pressure $= \dfrac{MLT^{-2}}{L^2} = ML^{-1}T^{-2}$.

questions.question: Given that Mass $= M$, Length $= L$, and Time $= T$, what is the dimension of density? (Density $=$ mass $/$ volume)
Given that Mass $= M$, Length $= L$, and Time $= T$, what is the dimension of torque? (Torque $=$ force $\times$ distance)
questions.explanation: Force $= MLT^{-2}$, distance $= L$, so torque $= MLT^{-2} \times L = ML^2T^{-2}$.

questions.question: Given that $1\,\text{kg} = 2.2\,\text{lbm}$ (pound mass), what is $500\,\text{g} + 0.7\,\text{lbm}$? (Express in kg)
Given that $1\,\text{kg} = 2.2\,\text{lbm}$, what is $2300\,\text{g} + 4.6\,\text{lbm}$? (Express in kg)
Given that $1\,\text{kg} = 2.2\,\text{lbm}$, what is $4\,\text{kg} + 2932\,\text{g} + 3.76\,\text{lbm}$? (Express in kg)
Given that $1\,\text{inch} = 2.54\,\text{cm}$, what is $7.32\,\text{m} + 182\,\text{inches} + 38.2\,\text{cm}$? (Express in meters)
Given that $1\,\text{inch} = 2.54\,\text{cm}$, what is $9.15\,\text{m} + 231\,\text{inches} + 141\,\text{cm}$? (Express in meters)

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You've mastered dimensional analysis and complex unit conversions.
scoreMessages.70: Good work! Review the relationships between units and practice converting between systems.
scoreMessages.50: Keep practicing. Focus on deriving dimensions and handling mixed units carefully.
scoreMessages.0: Let's review. Study the basic dimensions and practice converting step by step.
